title: How to Make Lemon Paste

steps.headline: Cut the lemons through the middle.
Put them into a saucepan of boiling water and boil them until tender.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Blend them to form a paste.
steps.description: Strain any excess liquid or pulp (see "Tips" below for using a mortar and pestle at this step.)

steps.headline: Add the sugar to the paste.
Roll it out onto a baking tray lined with baking paper.
Place in the oven on a very low heat for several hours until dried.
steps.description: Turn frequently. If you choose to sun dry, this will take several days and should also be turned frequently. Keep sun-drying lemon paste protected from insects.

steps.headline: Put it into an air-tight storage container.
steps.description: It will keep for up to one year.
